message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of communicating information over a network in the presence of an adversary who can eavesdrop and inject malicious errors. This problem is related to information theory (cs.IT) as it involves coding schemes to transmit information reliably and secretly. The paper also discusses the use of network coding, which falls under the category of computer networks (cs.NI). The presence of an adversary who can inject errors and eavesdrop on the communication makes this paper relevant to the field of computer security (cs.CR). The paper also discusses the use of polynomial-time algorithms, which is related to the field of algorithms and data structures (cs.DS). Finally, the paper discusses the use of secret communication, which is related to the field of social and information networks (cs.SI).
